thread.title: Sydney man charged for making up story his pug was stolen
thread.title_full: Sydney man charged for making up story his pug was stolen | Daily Mail Online

author: Cindy Tran for Daily Mail Australia
title: Sydney man charged for making up story his pug was stolen
text:
A man who claimed his beloved pet dog was stolen at knifepoint during a violent robbery has been accused of making up the story.
The 29-year-old man initially told police three men, armed with knives, threatened him when he was walking his 14-week-old pug named Egg along Australia Avenue in Sydney Olympic Park on February 9.
The men demanded he hand over his wallet and backpack before they fled the scene along with the black pug.
A 29-year-old man (pictured) who claimed his pet pug dog named Egg (right) was stolen at knifepoint during a violent robbery has been accused of making up the story
The dog owner contacted police and a search was underway for the three men and pug.
However, on Tuesday night, the man attended Auburn Police Station to speak to police.
Following investigations, the man was issued with a court attendance notice for false representation resulting in police investigation.
The man had told police three men snatched his beloved pet dog at knifepoint on February 9
He has since been charged with making a false report of a robbery.
The man will appear in the Burwood Local Court on April 6.
The whereabouts of Egg the pug dog is unknown, police say.
Anyone with information of the dogâ€™s whereabouts is urged to contact Crime Stoppers on 1800 333 000.
